Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2011 11:08AM angelinac wrote: Hi All, I am a 30 year old woman who tested pistive for BRCA1 recently, I had my first pelvic ultrasound yesterday and am going for an MRI in a couple of weeks as well. My Mom had and beat breast cancer and my maternal Aunt and Grandmother both died of breast cancer. All of them had breast cancer before menopause. The gentics center I went to said that I have a 68% chance of developing breast cancer and a 40% chance of developing ovarian cancer in the next 5-10 years. I am thinking in the next 5 years depending on how the MRI's and Ultrasounds go I may consider a masectomy and also removing my ovaries. I am recently separated from my husband and have one child. I am confortable with not having any more children unless a future spouse is insistent. I am curious what your percentages were before you considered a masectomy?
